tweets.text:
BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t
We're watching @EnvAgency https://t.co/vne2OG6gjf

Curiouser and curiouser.

The redoubtable @bettwsresident CEO of @WUFoundation making it very clear  that @EnvAgencyMids were alerted to the destruction that was taking place on the River Lugg last week. 

Did EA the respond? If not why not.

Starts 8:37

https://t.co/XbNCDTpqIL

urls.title: Hereford & Worcester - Listen Live - BBC Sounds
urls.description: Catch up on your favourite BBC radio show from your favourite DJ right here, whenever you like. Listen without limits with BBC Sounds.

tweets.text:
"Be in no doubt that anything less than a prosecution and full restoration of the river, paid for by the perpetrator, will be acceptable”.

@EnvAgency and others want to prove they are fit for the 21st century? Here's your chance. https://t.co/ji0wmcYyhf

We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status. We're treating this very seriously, working with @NaturalEngland & @ForestryComm who have taken immediate action to prevent any further works at the site. https://t.co/bvhnTETfal
Our piece by @GlassJet on the depressing news of the destruction of a stretch of Herefordshire's River Lugg  @EnvAgency @WildlifeTrusts  https://t.co/CaNN4WVP5J

After five years of planning and two years of works... 
🥁 🥁 🥁 

The River Keekle restoration is FINISHED!! 🥳 🎉 

All footpaths are now re-opened - thanks for your patience. 

Massive thanks to #WEG @EnvAgencyNW @AquaUoS @AECOM @OpenSpaceGB @NECumbria @woodlandscouk https://t.co/IW84GxKZrn

A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

urls.title: Horror at destruction of nationally important UK river | The Wildlife Trusts
urls.description: Major damage to River Lugg in Herefordshire will be test case for Government commitment to strengthen wildlife protection.

tweets.text: We're taking reports of environmental damage to the #SSSI at the #RiverLugg very seriously, and are working with @EnvAgency and @ForestryComm to take immediate action. https://t.co/27DINp3vD7
⚠️ Walcot Ford near Drakes Broughton is closed 🤦‍♂️ https://t.co/Uelm7DgKrx

@EnglandByBoat Lots of similar scare stories being put about by the eco lobby at present, see River Lugg in Herefordshire for instance. It's always 'an environmental disaster', which never seems to happen...

This does of course mean there is more time for people across the country to ask their MP to support my Bill. The full list of MPs backing it can be found here https://t.co/tJMYUNxy4N. If you can’t see your MP named, ask them why not.

urls.title: #EndSewagePollution-SewageBill • Surfers Against Sewage
urls.description: Philip Dunne MP is the main sponsor of this Bill and will be there when the Bill is debated. How about telling your friends and family to contact their MP? Your MP has already pledged their support for the Bill but we really need them to show up for our rivers and attend the second reading debate. It looks like your MP does not make an email address available to their constituents. You can write to them at their postal address. Find the details on your MP's parliamentary page. Thank you for supporting The

tweets.text:
“This is one of the most egregious acts of ecological vandalism that I have seen in 25 years of working on rivers in the UK.  I have been on site and I am shaking with anger at what has been done to my local river."

Said Guy Linley-Adams for S&TC,

https://t.co/QEc4mOcFy6 https://t.co/bEd0vyNbHl
@Matt_Greenwings @CraigBennett3 @EdJudeNature @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @WildlifeTrusts It wasn't.

Heavy rain overnight has led to several Flood Alerts and Flood Warnings in the South East.

Please be careful if you’re out and about. Don’t walk or drive through flood water – just 30cms or 12ins can move your car #floodaware

Check you flood risk at https://t.co/7zkYsvwvQB https://t.co/M7uB5PoazW

tweets.text:
Global Commission on Adaptation Commissioner @EmmaHowardBoyd outlines the @EnvAgency new flood strategy that prepares #UK coastal communities for #climatechange. 

It's just one example of a #ResilientRecovery. To learn more, join us for #AdaptationWeek: https://t.co/j91yOklfzi https://t.co/gtXXNru3ag

News: #Anlaby and #EastElla #Flood Alleviation Scheme wins prestigious national accolade https://t.co/LDvFKPUX3K

#FloodAlleviation #News @Hullccnews  @EnvAgency  #RICSAwards https://t.co/Yjb6yM4RCS

Schools, charities and local authorities as well as clubs and fisheries to benefit from the rising popularity in fishing

There's grant funding available from extra licence sales this year

#fishing #fishinglife @AnglingTrust @EnvAgency

https://t.co/Ctjdj9vm96

@DavidGJOHNS1 I've been waiting for an excuse to nerd out about velocimetry since I left the @EnvAgency 2 years ago, so this was music to my ears.

It's part of some work to estimate zooplankton swimming speeds from acoustic data - exciting stuff, if it works! 😁

@EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Glad to hear your on the case I'd like to know
1. Who is the land owner?
2. Did they do this themselves or contractors?
3. If so who are the Contractors who carried out the work?
4. Will you he prosecuting both the Land Owner and Contractors as the Land Owner?

@hold_bag @Countrymaned @morss_alex @HerefordshireWT @CraigBennett3 @WildlifeTrusts @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgencySE They have no money anymore, better to direct your question to @DefraGovUK or @MPGeorgeEustice

@MikeDWinter @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency There is precedent for that kind of thing. Solihull Borough Council forced the reconstruction of Monkspath Hall by the contractor who "accidentally" demolished it in (I think) the 1970s.
Our piece by @GlassJet on the depressing news of the destruction of a stretch of Herefordshire's River Lugg  @EnvAgency @WildlifeTrusts  https://t.co/CaNN4WVP5J

🤔 #DYK that there are more living organisms in a tablespoon of soil than there are people on Earth? 🌱🐛🐜

For #WorldSoilDay on 5 December, join @FAO to learn more about #SoilBiodiversity and its importance for life on Earth. 🌍

➡️ https://t.co/pit87QV6v0 https://t.co/nC6Dp6MCS3

tweets.text:
How can the govt claim to be leading the world in its green credentials when 
a) its cuts to watchdogs like @EnvAgency & @NaturalEngland undermine their ability to investigate & prosecute environmental crimes 
b) it’s boosting money for roads while cutting investment for rail?
